newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: EMB-NOL in Australia, SEA container servic.
newsitem.headline: EMB-NOL in Australia, SEA container servic.

text.p: Neptune Orient Lines Ltd (NOL) said on Tuesday it would jointly with ANL Ltd, PT Djarkarta Lloyd, Nippon Yusen Kaisha and P&O Containers Ltd introduce a new container service between Australia and South East Asia.
P&O Containers is a unit of UK shipping giant Peninsular & Oriental Steam Navigation Co.
NOL said in a statement the new service which would start from January 23 would supersede the current services provided by ANRO & ASA consortia.

The new service features five larger lift on-lift off vessels of up to 2,300 TEU capacity. The vessels would be deployed on a 35-day round voyage schedule offering weekly sailings from Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide, Fremantle, Singapore. Port Klang, Jakarta with Brisbane and Tasmania being serviced fortnightly.
The service also offer higher reefer capacity to cater for significant volumes of time-sensitive refrigerated exports from Australia.
